elements.title: The Red Moon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Red Moon (sheet music pictured) was the first Broadway show to depict alliances between African Americans and Native Americans?

elements.title: Xu Garden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Xu Garden was created by community residents grateful to their local warlord?

elements.title: Stefano Černetić (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while pretending to be a prince of Montenegro, Italian journalist Stefano Černetić met with royalty and made Pamela Anderson a countess?

elements.title: Integrated Visual Augmentation System (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that more than 50 Microsoft engineers opposed the development of the Integrated Visual Augmentation System, as they believed this made them war profiteers?

elements.title: Rhinecliff station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rhinecliff station was unusually large for a small hamlet due to the influence of John Jacob Astor IV and Levi P. Morton?

elements.title: M-Beat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sinéad O'Connor personally invited M-Beat to remix her single "Fire on Babylon" after meeting him backstage at Top of the Pops?

elements.title: 2026 FIFA World Cup final (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2026 FIFA World Cup final will be hosted by a stadium that is cutting corners?

elements.title: Are We There Yet? (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before charting on the UK Albums Chart with Are We There Yet?, the indie rock musician James Marriott had made a career of mocking other YouTubers' music?

elements.title: San Rafael Falls (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that San Rafael Falls, once Ecuador's largest waterfall, was swallowed by a sinkhole in February 2020 and no longer exists?
